creator: propulse@propulse.net
text:
I want to use the rmic task.
Here is my code :

<project name="Monprojet" default="compile" basedir=".">
<target name="compile">
	<property name="build.rmic" value="sun"/>
	<rmic base="E:\J2EE\workspace\rmi"  
classname="fr.fc.frcregistry.core.DialogueImpl"/>
</target>
</project>

But the answer is :
E:\J2EE\workspace\rmi\build.xml:4: Cannot use SUN rmic, as it is not available 
A common solution is to set the environment variable JAVA_HOME or CLASSPATH.

But my classpath as a reference on the jar including all the classes required 
for rmic, and my JAVA_HOMES is perfect !

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
OK, let's see.

JAVA_HOME is set in a way that JAVA_HOME/lib/tools.jar exists and tools.jar
contains sun/rmi/rmic/Main.class?

If so, how do you invoke ant?  Are you using the ant.bat script?
